issue.title: [C++][Python] Rename arrow::fs::Selector to FileSelector
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6463](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6463). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
In both the C++ implementation and the python binding.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6463?focusedCommentId=16933261) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
`[~fsaintjacques]` What's your opinion?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6463?focusedCommentId=16933300) by Francois Saint-Jacques (fsaintjacques):*
I'd think that `FindOptions` would fit as it's similar to `find(1)` options, but this is my POSIX shell centric-view. But FileSelector is better than Selector.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6463?focusedCommentId=16988211) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
`[~kszucs]` it would be better to do this before 1.0.0.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6463?focusedCommentId=16997323) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 6035
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6035>
